programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The young-at-heart trio negotiate insurance companies and accident repairs in the search for the perfect car for a 17-year-old - Stephen Fry is their quite interesting guest.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The Doctor is Waiting: Mike and Frank are scolded when they arrive late for an appointment with Dr Fred - and find themselves in a strange world once they get past his grumpy assistant.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Pickers Like It Hot: Mike and Frank try to broker a deal on an original Bowie Knife in Massachusetts and discover a Hollywood collection with never-seen before photos of Marilyn Monroe.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape

programme.desc: No Loan Again, Naturally: When Homer and Marge's mortgage rate skyrockets, they have to put their house up for sale - and Flanders buys it and becomes their landlord.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Gone Maggie Gone: When Marge is temporarily blinded, Homer loses Maggie to a convent and Lisa has to go undercover as a nun to find her.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - Wad Goals: New episodes come to E4. Bart becomes a successful caddy but Marge worries that it's ruining his character.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - Yokel Hero: New episodes come to E4. Cletus becomes a singing sensation, while Homer becomes a new man. But when Cletus turns on his fans he ruins everything.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex...
programme.desc: ...Experiment: Tom and Kirsty check in to fulfil Tom's fantasy of experimenting with another man. Natalie and Tom explore a threesome, but will insecurities get in the way?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: TV's sharpest armchair critics watch Strictly Come Dancing, I'm a Celebrity... A Jungle Story, 24 Hours in Police Custody, Nigella's Cook, Eat, Repeat, and Naked Attraction.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: In the dating show that bares all, 20-year-old virgin Josh seeks a princess to help pop his cherry. And Matt and Mary look for a third person to join them in bed.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Kids These Days: Haley needs motherly advice as she considers her future with Dylan and her career. Jay and Cam's politically incorrect coaching earns them a sensitivity lesson.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Goldbergs Never Say Die!: Adam and his friends go on a treasure hunt inspired by comedy adventure film The Goonies when Pops misplaces some family jewels.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: TV's sharpest armchair critics watch Strictly Come Dancing, I'm a Celebrity... A Jungle Story, 24 Hours in Police Custody, Nigella's Cook, Eat, Repeat, and Naked Attraction.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: All eyes are on Darren after he's caught in a compromising situation. Ro takes extreme measures to protect himself. Frankie turns to Dillon. And Vicky seeks advice from unlikely ally Grace.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Frankie turns to Dillon as she tries to escape her emotions. Things get heated when two mums try to protect their children. And there's a heartfelt moment between the Roscoe brothers.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: With a secret threatening to expose Vicky, she turns to unlikely ally Grace for advice. A resident is worried when a cat goes missing, and Freddie receives an unexpected gift.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Mixing Bowl: Gordon Ramsay visits bijou New York diner The Mixing Bowl, which is haemorrhaging money, thanks to manager Mike's out-of-control marketing plans.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Captain Kim: A new captain at the Nine-Nine attempts to ingratiate herself with Jake and the squad by inviting them over to her house for a dinner party.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Pimemento: Adrian Pimento shows up unexpectedly to seek Jake and Charles' help after claiming that someone is trying to kill him.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Body Glitter and a Mall Safety Kit: Sheldon learns to listen when an emotional Paige (Mckenna Grace) struggles with her parents' divorce.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Contracts, Rules and a Little Bit of Pig Brains: George Sr and Georgie go camping with Meemaw's new man, but things get complicated when her ex-boyfriend tags along.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pulled Groin Extrapolation: Leonard goes to a colleague's wedding as Amy's date. Howard tries to convince Bernadette to live with his mum after they get married.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wiggly Finger Catalyst: Raj begins to get upset that he's the only one of the four guys not in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find him the perfect date.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Written in the Stars: Phil thinks that Gloria is upset with Jay for dropping the ball on Valentine's Day, so he convinces Jay to spice things up with a little role playing.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Wine Weekend: The family go on a wine-tasting trip, and Gloria and Mitch are invited to a party at Oprah's house - but they can't bring anyone else.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fizbo: Phil and Claire throw Luke the biggest birthday party a boy could want. But when Cameron appears as a clown named Fizbo, it sets off a chain of events that ends in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Opening Night Excitation: Leonard, Howard and Raj have an extra ticket for the Star Wars movie premiere but can't decide who they should give it to.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Sales Call Sublimation: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard meets a psychiatrist, while Sheldon and Raj make an astronomical discovery.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Empathy Optimization: The gang plan a Sheldon-free weekend in Las Vegas after coping with his constant demands, rudeness and ingratitude when he was ill.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Graduation: After graduating from high school, Sheldon struggles to cope when he realises that he may not be ready for college.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Docent, a Little Lady and a Bouncer Named Dalton: Sheldon gets his dream summer job at the local train museum. And Georgie discovers Mary's guilty pleasure.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A Sketchy Area: Phil finds a new career after visiting Luke's college. Mitch's new case as an assistant DA is marred by an unflattering courtroom sketch by the resident artist.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Torn Between Two Lovers: Haley struggles when she must choose between her past and present relationships. Manny returns to college while his girlfriend stays at Jay and Gloria's.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bull-E: Bart is picked on at the school dance, so Marge convinces Springfield's authorities to pass anti-bullying legislation. But then Homer is arrested for victimising Ned.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mathlete's Feat: Groundskeeper Willie coaches Lisa and the school Mathlympics team for an important maths quiz.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Military Miniaturization: Howard has a meeting with Air Force representative Colonel Williams about the gyroscope he invented with Leonard and Sheldon.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Dependence Transcendence: Tensions rise when the guys struggle to complete their Air Force project on time and are forced to work around the clock.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cohabitation Experimentation: When Amy's flat is flooded, she has to move out while it is being repaired and proposes a 'cohabitation experiment' with Sheldon.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In the Name of the Grandfather: Homer takes the family to Ireland so that Grampa can visit quaint village pub O'Flanagan's one last time.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A revealed secret sends shockwaves through the village, and a revenge plan is set in motion. Nancy fears that she can't trust Darren, while a suspicious Ste does some investigating.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fizbo: Phil and Claire throw Luke the biggest birthday party a boy could want. But when Cameron appears as a clown named Fizbo, it sets off a chain of events that ends in hospital.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Strong Arms of the Ma: When Marge is mugged, she reacts by working out with weights, but goes too far and ends up as a steroid-crazed bully.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pray Anything: Jealous of Flanders' lifestyle, Homer starts to pray for material possessions, but things get out of hand when he asks for a bigger house and gets the church.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight UK:...
programme.desc: ...Reunion Special: Brand new: Fan faves from 2023 and 2024 reunite for a cosy country getaway. But it wouldn't be a MAFS reunion without a drama-fuelled dinner party and the Honesty Box...

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics watch Strictly Come Dancing, The Crown, I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, Naked Attraction, and BBC News on Dominic Cummings.

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: (1972) A Mafia don's son struggles to become a legitimate businessman in Francis Ford Coppola's classic crime drama. Starring Al Pacino, Marlon Brando, James Caan and Robert Duvall.

programme.title: The Motorcycle Diaries
programme.desc: (2004) Gael Garcia Bernal stars in Walter Salles' film as a young Che Guevara whose journey through South America realises his radical ideas. In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: (2011) Animated Wild West comedy with Johnny Depp. A pet chameleon accidentally becomes the sheriff of small frontier town, Dirt. Can he defend it? Oh, and he's got a mate called Roadkill.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Howards End
programme.desc: (1992) Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Emma Thompson star in James Ivory's adaptation of EM Forster's novel about two families, love, treachery and revenge.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: (2007) Action adventure. Shia LaBeouf gets caught up in a battle between two groups of violent shape-shifting robots, one of which - the Decepticons - is out to destroy humanity.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: (1974) De Niro and Pacino star in Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-laden crime family drama - the greatest ever sequel? - as it explores Vito Corleone's early life and Michael's rise to power.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: (1988) Action-thriller with Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. Can a New York cop free the hostages being held in a skyscraper by an arch villain? Yippee ki-yay... whoops, can't say that here.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.
programme.desc: (1966) Raquel Welch - in her famous fur bikini - stars in this prehistoric adventure set in an inhospitable landscape populated by two warring tribes and Ray Harryhausen's roving dinosaurs.

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: (2003) Family comedy with Mike Myers. A badly behaved boy and his super-organised sister are plunged into an anarchic adventure when a man-sized talking cat suddenly appears at their home.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy adventure. Jack Black stars as the would-be travel writer Lemuel Gulliver, who gets stranded on an island of tiny people in this updating of Jonathan Swift's classic novel.

programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc: (2006) Biographical drama starring Will Smith as Chris Gardner, the down-on-his-luck salesman who risked it all to provide a better life for himself and his son.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death...
programme.desc: ...of Michael Corleone: The 2020 cut of The Godfather Part III, starring Al Pacino and Diane Keaton. Michael tries to go straight and wrestles with his past.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: (2002) Scorsese's epic drama with Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel Day-Lewis and Cameron Diaz. As gang warfare dictates 1860s New York, an orphan seeks revenge against his father's killer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: BSL Zone: This Is Deaf
programme.desc: In this programme we celebrate February - the month of love - by exploring Deaf dating - covering everything from dating in the 1970s to navigating the modern dating landscape.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: (1957) Western. A Union army deserter sets out to turn his Texan hometown's womenfolk into sharpshooters in order to repel a Comanche attack. Starring Audie Murphy and Kathryn Grant.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: (1962) War film with Steve McQueen and Robert Wagner. A US pilot stationed in Britain during WWII alienates his comrades with his self-serving antics.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: (1957) The final Ealing comedy stars Alec Guinness as the latest in a long and distinguished line of sailors, but there's a problem: he suffers from seasickness. So why not buy a pier?

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: Nomadland
programme.desc: (2020) BAFTA, Golden Globe and Oscar-winning docu-drama with Frances McDormand. A middle-aged woman with no money makes a van her home and takes to the roads of America looking for work.

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: Corsage
programme.desc: (2022) Marie Kreutzer's tightly corseted biographical drama starring Vicky Krieps as a quietly defiant Empress Elisabeth of Austria as she turns 40 on Christmas Eve 1877. In German/subs.

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: (1972) A Mafia don's son struggles to become a legitimate businessman in Francis Ford Coppola's classic crime drama. Starring Al Pacino, Marlon Brando, James Caan and Robert Duvall.

programme.title: The Motorcycle Diaries
programme.desc: (2004) Gael Garcia Bernal stars in Walter Salles' film as a young Che Guevara whose journey through South America realises his radical ideas. In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: News at 10 with Anna Botting
programme.desc: A comprehensive round-up of the main news stories of the day from the UK and around the world.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: Lively debate and discussion with our panel of paper reviewers about the stories making tomorrow morning's newspapers.

programme.title: News & Press Preview
programme.desc: The key stories of the day plus debate and discussion with our panel of reviewers on the stories making the morning newspapers in the extended press preview.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: Lively debate and discussion with our panel of paper reviewers about the stories making tomorrow morning's newspapers.

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Olivia confronts the boys with their worst nightmare: will they hand over their phones to their girlfriends?

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as 10 amateur designers go head to head in a competition to win a coveted dream job as a junior fashion designer for high street giant M&S. Over six episodes, the competitors will be tested on their design, problem-solving, commerciality and collaboration skills and judged by a panel of senior leaders at the company alongside a rotation of celebrity guests and designers. In their first challenge, the contestants are tasked with creating womenswear clothing under the watchful eye of guest judge Mel B

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian's adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant that's been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then it's back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Ben and Georgie Ainslie into his kitchen to sample some recipes from Cyrus Todiwala and Jose Pizarro. Merlin Griffiths is at the bar crafting cocktails

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: James heads east to the region of Jura where he barbecues duck and uses the apple and pears of a local orchard. Plus, he visits the home of Comte cheese!

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Rishi Persad presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Pendil Novices' Chase from Kempton Park, plus the Eider Chase at Newcastle, and the Winter Derby from Southwell. Analysis from Luke Harvey and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and plus commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match from the third round of fixtures at Allianz Stadium, Twickenham. The visitors will be looking to extend their winning streak against their old rivals to five matches and retain the Calcutta Cup. Last year's match saw Duhan van der Merwe become the first Scottish player to score a hat-trick in this fixture as Scotland triumphed 30-21, and that was on the back of another dazzling solo performance in 2023 when he scored two tries at this venue, including one of the most memorable in the history of this illustrious fixture. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Johnnie Beattie and Ugo Monye, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Jim Hamilton, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a cash prize of 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli return to the judging panel with special guest judge KSI

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes restaurateur Gordon Ramsay, actor Danny Dyer, stage and screen star Vanessa Williams, 2024 Sports Personality of the Year Keely Hodgkinson and star of Babygirl Harris Dickinson to his sofa. Plus, a performance by singer-songwriter Joan Armatrading

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Murder of Bianca Devins: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: A young woman in upstate New York is murdered and the killer posts footage of his heinous crime all over social media - when her family are sent the gruesome images of the crime before the police have had a chance to confirm what has happened, the family are then forced to battle social media platforms to remove the awful evidence from the internet

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Sunderland v Hull City at Stadium of Light, Swansea City v Blackburn Rovers at Swansea.com Stadium and Portsmouth v Queens Park Rangers at Fratton Park in the Championship

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Felicity Kendal, Nigel Havers and Jessica Hynes join Alan and Meirion Owen gives a lesson in sheepdog training. Camilla Bassett-Smith and Chris Hull spruce up the green house and Ian Burrell makes rum cocktails for all seasons

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Leicestershire, Alan and the team head to the town of Hinckley to surprise 96-year-old Second World War veteran Gordon with a stunning garden transformation. Alan sets about bringing a classic beautiful English country garden to this inaccessible space that includes raised beds in dry stone walls, a sociable seating area, a mini-orchard and an outdoor room

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Eddie Kadi lead contestants on a mission to draw images that match a word or phrase from a specific category. The team-mates will have to guess correctly to score. Game show, hosted by Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v France (Kick-off 3.00pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the concluding match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Italy narrowly missed out on a historic victory at Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille last year when Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post after the ball fell off the tee and resulted in a rushed attempt to beat the shot clock, and the encounter ended in a 13-13 draw. The previous meeting in Rome two years ago also appeared to be going in favour of the Azzurri as they led 24-22 in the second half, only for a Matthieu Jalibert try to dash their hopes in a 29-24 loss. With analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Sergio Parisse, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman, and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the five remaining couples perform routines inspired by well-known musicals in hope of securing a place in the semi-final. Plus, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe open the show and the cast of Moulin Rouge! The Musical bring the West End to the ice

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Laura Kenny and Krishnan Guru-Murthy answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. If they get stuck, they have four lifelines available, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Lies are uncovered as Mel and Asif are taken into custody, Juliet tries to protect Taylor and herself against the investigation, a possible witness to the body's disposal is found, and Jess plans a conversation with Steve

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: Action adventure starring Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz. A chance encounter at an airport with spy Roy Miller embroils mechanic June Havens in a frantic and life-threatening chase across the globe. But can June really trust this man of mystery, especially given his penchant for rendering her unconscious when trouble rears its head?

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: Kelvin is in the market for a bull in his mission to expand the cow herd and Marnie checks in on her Jacob's sheep, with plans to put the tup in soon as she plans ahead for lambing season. Milo, Kelvin and his dad start to work on an old vintage tractor that they bought for the twins in a second-hand sale, and the Fletchers celebrate another successful year on the farm by inviting all their friends over to say thank you

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team of antiques dealers are at Walsall Football Club in the West Midlands where they meet a young seller whose technique to get the best price for her gold is to 'just keep saying no', Tim Hogarth pays nearly four times the expected amount for a family jewellery collection and a seller brings in a collection of 400 First World War postcards

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Looking for the winning words today are folk music-loving couple Tim and Kim, mother and daughter Nicola and Tia-Dene and Gloucestershire couple Dawn and Simon

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Olly from Essex, Michelle from Northampton, Carl from Birmingham and Laura from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Daisy reveals the identity of her baby's father, Todd encounters Julie again, Cassie gets up to her old tricks, and Betsy tries to keep Dylan positive about the future

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Jess and Sunny finally get the truth from Asif, Marty, Mel and Juliet as Gerry Cooper's killer is revealed. However, the outcome leads to difficult decisions both on and off the case

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Keane & Vieira - Best of Enemies
programme.desc: The on-field rivalry between midfielders Roy Keane and Patrick Vieira during their time at Manchester United and Arsenal respectively, when they strived for dominance in a golden period for the clubs. There was no love lost between the two combative players, who captained their teams and enjoyed many memorable battles in the quest for Premier League glory. In this programme, Gabriel Clarke interviews both men

programme.title: Scotland Tonight

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Olivia confronts the boys with their worst nightmare: will they hand over their phones to their girlfriends?

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as 10 amateur designers go head to head in a competition to win a coveted dream job as a junior fashion designer for high street giant M&S. Over six episodes, the competitors will be tested on their design, problem-solving, commerciality and collaboration skills and judged by a panel of senior leaders at the company alongside a rotation of celebrity guests and designers. In their first challenge, the contestants are tasked with creating womenswear clothing under the watchful eye of guest judge Mel B

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian's adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant that's been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then it's back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: James heads east to the region of Jura where he barbecues duck and uses the apple and pears of a local orchard. Plus, he visits the home of Comte cheese!

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kempton
programme.desc: Rishi Persad presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Pendil Novices' Chase from Kempton Park, plus the Eider Chase at Newcastle, and the Winter Derby from Southwell. Analysis from Luke Harvey and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and plus commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match from the third round of fixtures at Allianz Stadium, Twickenham. The visitors will be looking to extend their winning streak against their old rivals to five matches and retain the Calcutta Cup. Last year's match saw Duhan van der Merwe become the first Scottish player to score a hat-trick in this fixture as Scotland triumphed 30-21, and that was on the back of another dazzling solo performance in 2023 when he scored two tries at this venue, including one of the most memorable in the history of this illustrious fixture. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Johnnie Beattie and Ugo Monye, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Jim Hamilton, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a cash prize of 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli return to the judging panel with special guest judge KSI

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.desc: A young woman in upstate New York is murdered and the killer posts footage of his heinous crime all over social media - when her family are sent the gruesome images of the crime before the police have had a chance to confirm what has happened, the family are then forced to battle social media platforms to remove the awful evidence from the internet

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: In Leicestershire, Alan and the team head to the town of Hinckley to surprise 96-year-old Second World War veteran Gordon with a stunning garden transformation. Alan sets about bringing a classic beautiful English country garden to this inaccessible space that includes raised beds in dry stone walls, a sociable seating area, a mini-orchard and an outdoor room

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye and Eddie Kadi lead contestants on a mission to draw images that match a word or phrase from a specific category. The team-mates will have to guess correctly to score. Game show, hosted by Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v France (Kick-off 3.00pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of the concluding match in the third round of fixtures, which takes place at Stadio Olimpico in Rome. Italy narrowly missed out on a historic victory at Stade Pierre-Mauroy in Lille last year when Paolo Garbisi's injury-time penalty hit the post after the ball fell off the tee and resulted in a rushed attempt to beat the shot clock, and the encounter ended in a 13-13 draw. The previous meeting in Rome two years ago also appeared to be going in favour of the Azzurri as they led 24-22 in the second half, only for a Matthieu Jalibert try to dash their hopes in a 29-24 loss. With analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, pitchside reports by Gabriel Clarke and Sergio Parisse, and commentary by Miles Harrison, Nolli Waterman, and David Flatman

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the five remaining couples perform routines inspired by well-known musicals in hope of securing a place in the semi-final. Plus, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe open the show and the cast of Moulin Rouge! The Musical bring the West End to the ice

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a mushroom monsoon curry with grapes, some barbecued corn on the cob and a cote de boeuf with chilli rub. She also visits a local butcher who has been in business in the area for over 180 years

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: Kelvin is in the market for a bull in his mission to expand the cow herd and Marnie checks in on her Jacob's sheep, with plans to put the tup in soon as she plans ahead for lambing season. Milo, Kelvin and his dad start to work on an old vintage tractor that they bought for the twins in a second-hand sale, and the Fletchers celebrate another successful year on the farm by inviting all their friends over to say thank you

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Olly from Essex, Michelle from Northampton, Carl from Birmingham and Laura from Bristol pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds.
